intro: Oenothera pratincola, commonly known as the plains evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a hairy texture. Oenothera pratincola is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its role in supporting pollinators like moths and beetles.
